Description: Two joining fragments of wall of East Greek pottery bowl; inside glazed with two added red bands lined in white low down; exterior very worn: rays at base, frieze of triple verticals and perhaps rosettes above; some use of added colours, hard to discern. Graffito outside on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Ink label 'List 38'; also pencil '38' on inside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1079)
